name: Renaissance Pittsburgh Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here during a business trip to Pittsburgh and enjoyed my visit at this historic hotel. It is located almost directly across the river from PNC Bank Park (home of the Pirates) and the waterfront is very scenic.
reviews.title: Elegant business class hotel, good service great location

reviews.text: The hotel's lobby is extraordinarily beautiful, it looks like it was an old elegant theater lobby. I don't know the history of the place but I would be interested to learn more about it. You feel like you step back in time to a more elegant and civilized world when you enter the lobby.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel.... Thoroughly impressed by STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice and comfortable. Plenty of outlets for your electronic devices. Both the wired and wireless internet service was a little clunky and slow. My only complaint about the rooms were the temperature controls, the room was a warm for my comfort when sleeping and couldn't cool it down. I did open the window which helped a great deal.
reviews.title: The Pefect Experience

reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and made the say enjoyable.
reviews.title: great people make this hotel

reviews.text: Renaissance management.... let me take this opportunity to THANK YOU for hiring such wonderful staff at your hotel. After a long and miserable flight in from California, it was wonderful to be greeted by such warm and welcoming employees. A young gentleman, I believe his name was Mark, checked me into the hotel with such ease. He was the first friendly, warm person that I encountered on my entire trip. I was starving after traveling for so long, and Mark recommended a great place to eat at nearby. Kudos to Mark! The hotel is beautiful inside.... rooms are gorgeous and clean. When business takes me to Pittsburgh again, I will be sure to stay at the Renaissance. A+ accommodations with A+ staff.
reviews.title: wouldn't stay anywhere else

reviews.text: Staff very friendly, i didn't find hotel right away since I didnt have GPS, seems very nice, kind of elegant as opposed to calling it old. Simple room, not enough electrical outlets in convienent spots in the room. No USA Today outside my room when i left in the morning. The PNC Park Baseball Stadium is right over the bridge, five minute walk. Also in immediate vicinity are some indian restaurants I noticed. Don't get my average rating wrong, i just didn't stay long enough for me take advantage of of what the hotel has to offer. No free parking, valet costs 28 dollars or self-park across lot for 10 dollars overnight but can't go in and out I believe.
reviews.title: Quick Recap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second trip to this hotel, and it has been great both times. We went to the Pirates' ballpark for a couple of games, and the hotel is directly across the main pedestrian bridge to the ballpark. The hotel is right on one of the rivers, and was a very short walk from the Arts Festival. We also walked to one of the inclines, across a bridge, and it did not take long at all.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic location

reviews.text: The service at the hotel is great, the rooms are clean, the bathroom was large, and the rooms are well-stocked (bathroom amenities, refrigerator, snacks and drinks). The room was very quiet, except that some of our neighbors slammed their doors; not much the hotel can do about that, though. The restaurant and bar are both very good as well.
reviews.title: Bloody good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had some nice food from the restaurants in the neighborhood: good pizza, good Greek food. We found inexpensive parking directly across the street, too: $10 per day, $5 for the weekend.
reviews.title: The best hotel experience of our life!

reviews.text: The hotel has free wi-fi, too; it was fast and reliable.
reviews.title: One cup of coffee

reviews.text: I traveled to Pitttsburgh for a conference. Sometimes, I deliberately stay off-site when attending a conference, because I don't want to see the same groups of people in the restaurants, in the pool, etc. Boy am I glad I didn't make that choice this time! What a beautiful hotel staffed by well-trained customer service providers! Every interaction was friendly and courteous. Check-in and check-out were easy and information about parking options readily available (no surprise fees for valet or surface lots -- it was all laid out on their website).
reviews.title: Best Views in Town, High Level Service!

reviews.text: The rooms are well-appointed and generously large. Wi-fi was free! I was fortunate enough to have a corner room on the 8th floor - overlooking the river. A fabulous location that made you eager to get up in the morning in order to see the sun playing off the bridge and the water. Also, other city attractions are very walkable from this location.
reviews.title: A Feast for Eyes and Pocketbook!

reviews.text: My only concrete recommendations are the following: 1) Don't cool the meeting rooms to such a low temperature. The only hotels I know of that get this right are the ones in Hawaii, where the windows are simply open. This is a constant problem at hotels, and I'm sure they get an equal number of people complaining about rooms being too hot. But, most of the attendees (who were predominantly female at this convening) were coming to sessions in their work clothes, but draped in fleece jackets, blankets, etc. 2) Provide clearer driving instructions for those from out of town. Because of the rivers, hills, and old roadways that the city expanded around, out-of-towners can find Pittsburgh to be a snarl of roads and highways.
reviews.title: Again-the people make this special

reviews.text: This hotel offered unprecendented, prompt and friendly service--they could not do enough! Room was perfectly appointed, and I did not want to get out of the bed! Elegant hotel and breathtaking architecture--situated conveniently to everything! Valet parking a little stiff, but hotel staffer kindly suggested the public parking garage across the street from the hotel, which was a huge savings! Between the elegance, convenience, and service, the rate for this hotel was fair and worth it! I will DEFINITELY return on my next visit to Pittsburgh!
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Downtown Pittsburgh

reviews.text: I stayed here June 3-5 to visit my family in Pgh., everyone goes out of their way to make sure guests are comfortable. It's also nice to see the same people again and again. This time, the Pgh Pirates were playing a home game, and I saw the most spectacular fire works from the room...amazing corner views. Thanks for everything.
reviews.title: Great downtown location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Renaissance on our trip and loved it. The only negatives are driving in Pittsburgh as the city is densely populated. You cannot beat the location right next to the river with theaters all over the place. There are also many restaurants around. We parked in the garage across the street for $9.75, better than the $28 valet charge. I had watched the prices on this hotel and they became lower a couple weeks before our trip commenced so I contacted Marriott Rewards and they changed the existing reservation to the much-lower rate. The hotel is historic and was renovated not long ago, giving it a nice retro look and feeling. We got a nice room on the 12th floor and had a good river view, which afforded us a front row seat to the deluge that started after (thankfully) we got to our room. The staff is all friendly and helpful and the doormen give directions and guidance as well as open doors. The room decor was a restful green color with high ceilings. It was also spacious and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Stay At The Renaissance

reviews.text: WOW - I always find it refreshing when you find a hotel with the benefits of being part of a major national chain but that doesn't suffer from being completely generic. The Renaissance Pittsburgh is one of those places.
reviews.title: Super style in downtown Pittsburgh
Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: I had a very late arrival into Pittsburgh, but arrived to find a very stylish lobby that still, despite the late hour, had some life. The front desk was staffed (avoiding one of those late arrival situations where you stand there waiting for the night manager to come out of the office) and my check-in was very quick and polite. The staff member quickly arranged a cab to pick me up in the morning and was knowledgeable about the local area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got in the elevator and was taken to a room with a fun, unique layout and shape and spectacular views of the river and downtown Pittsburgh. It had windows on two sides and was stylishly decorated. I hated to close the darkening curtains and take away the view! The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. All in all, I felt relaxed and a bit pampered -- exactly how you want to feel after a late arrival. After a few hours of sleep, I was back in the lobby, with a fast check-out and the cab waiting at the specified time.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Let's hope business brings me back to Pittsburgh so I can spend more time at this hotel! Very impressive.
reviews.title: Excellent service, very nice rooms

description: The Renaissance Pittsburgh Hotel in Pittsburgh, PA is an inspirational landmark, a bold fusion of classic and contemporary, where stunning architecture meets sleek, modern design. Located in the heart of the vibrant Cultural District and as one of the most historic hotels in downtown Pittsburgh, the Renaissance is housed in the iconic Fulton Building and exudes the urban sophistication of this cosmopolitan creative hub. Centrally located, the Renaissance Pittsburgh hotel is close to PNC Park, Heinz Field, the Consol Energy Center and the David L. Lawrence Convention Center, making it the ideal locale for seeing the best of what our exciting city has to offer. Exceptional works by celebrated local artists lend the space artistic flair, while light spills in through the stunning glass dome ceiling into the lobby below. From the start, the Renaissance Pittsburgh Hotel promises to be unforgettable. Discover one of the only luxury four-star hotels in downtown Pittsburgh. The Renaissance Pittsburgh Hotel combines artistic elegance and hip style with luxurious Pittsburgh accommodations and an excellent location, creating a hotel experience unlike any other in the Steel City.
